title: Looking for a digitised version of Letraset Renate
content:
Does any one know if the old Letraset Renate was ever converted for computrer?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Jo-Jo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114172424/http:/typophile.com/files/Jo-Jo.jpg) | 17.01 KB |
author: galicianer

comments.content: Not that I know of, but it's got [Nick Curtis](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114172424/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?did=2093) written all over it.

Renate is actually an [Alan Meeks](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114172424/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fonts&searchID=572&searchby=designer) number, but it's nowhere to be found. I wish that Letraset would either piss or get off the typographic pot. They have so many wonderful faces stuck in the analog world... gah.

Fontsquatting sucks yucky half-used dog-eared transfer sheets.

hhp
May those responsible burnish in hell.
